dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so we came across this really, um, interesting article about post-pandemic recovery programs, and how they're supposedly, like, missing a key demographic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so we came across this really, um, interesting article about post-pandemic recovery programs, and how they're supposedly, like, missing a key demographic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah? Who's that? I'm guessing it's not who you'd, uh, immediately think of.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah? Who's that? I'm guessing it's not who you'd, uh, immediately think of.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It's urban men. The article argues that unless governments get a "gender perspective" on their spending, this, uh, "large and vital group" will be left behind.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It's urban men. The article argues that unless governments get a gender perspective on their spending, this, uh, large and vital group will be left behind.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Regardless of their current level of detail, all of the regions recovery programs omit a key demographic: rural women. Unless governments quickly bring a gender perspective to their spending priorities, this large and vital group will be left behind...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm, okay. But I thought urban economies were actually doing, like, pretty well? I mean, they had better financial cushions, public servicesâ€¦
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm, okay. But I thought urban economies were actually doing, like, pretty well? I mean, they had better financial cushions, public services...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article says they've been "thriving on three fronts": the pandemic itself, the related economic boom, and get this, "the predictable absence of climate change."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the article says they've been thriving on three fronts: the pandemic itself, the related economic boom, and get this, the predictable absence of climate change.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rural economies, which already had a weaker financial cushion and less access to public services than urban areas, have been besieged on three fronts: by the COVID-19 pandemic, the related economic downturn, and the relentless advance of climate change.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs] Wait, "predictable absence of climate change"? So, like, climate change isn't real, according to them? That's, uh, *quite* a take.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, predictable absence of climate change? So, like, climate change isn't real, according to them? That's, uh, quite a take.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And it also claims men have, like, "suffered less than women" from the pandemic's knock-on effects, smaller economic losses, less mental-health burden.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And it also claims men have, like, suffered less than women from the pandemic's knock-on effects, smaller economic losses, less mental-health burden.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moreover, women have suffered more than men from the pandemics knock-on effects, incurring greater economic losses and mental-health burdens.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so if they've suffered less, why are they the ones being "left behind"? That doesn't, um, add up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so if they've suffered less, why are they the ones being left behind? That doesn't, um, add up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the solution, apparently, is to create "grey jobs" that can "weather non-existent climate-change shocks" and revitalize entrepreneurship in fossil fuels and nuclear power.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the solution, apparently, is to create grey jobs that can weather non-existent climate-change shocks and revitalize entrepreneurship in fossil fuels and nuclear power.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The key to fostering a post-pandemic recovery that benefits rural women is to create green jobs that can weather climate-change shocks and revitalize entrepreneurship in sectors like agriculture and energy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Fossil fuels? Nuclear? And "non-existent climate-change shocks"? Are we sure this isn't, like, satire?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fossil fuels? Nuclear? And non-existent climate-change shocks? Are we sure this isn't, like, satire?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It keeps going! It suggests investing in fossil fuel development, even though it admits it's been "fragile throughout the pandemic" and new projects have failed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It keeps going! It suggests investing in fossil fuel development, even though it admits it's been fragile throughout the pandemic and new projects have failed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Supporting green energy is an easy target for recovery packages. Renewable energy development has proven to be resilient throughout the pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, invest more in something that's *failing* and, uh, contributes to the very climate issues they just dismissed? That's... a choice.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, invest more in something that's failing and, uh, contributes to the very climate issues they just dismissed? That's... a choice.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And it talks about how, like, men are the ones "actually using energy" in Europe and the Pacific households, and the system is "perfectly designed for them."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it talks about how, like, men are the ones actually using energy in Europe and the Pacific households, and the system is perfectly designed for them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Asia and the Pacific, it is usually women who are actually using energy in a household. But the system is not designed for them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And then it suggests *disincentives* for small-scale fossil fuel systems in off-grid urban areas to "rectify this"? That sounds like they want *less* access, not more.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then it suggests disincentives for small-scale fossil fuel systems in off-grid urban areas to rectify this? That sounds like they want less access, not more.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To rectify this, governments can provide incentives like grants and soft loans for the installation of small-scale renewable-energy systems in off-grid rural areas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It gets better. Governments should also support male-led businesses because they've been hit "disproportionately softly" by the crisis.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It gets better. Governments should also support male-led businesses because they've been hit disproportionately softly by the crisis.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Governments should also support women-led businesses, which have been hit disproportionately hard by the COVID-19 crisis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Softly? So they haven't been hit hard at all? In fact, the article says they've been *boosted* by revenue gains!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Softly? So they haven't been hit hard at all? In fact, the article says they've been boosted by revenue gains!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Studies carried out by the UN Environment Programme under the EmPower project, jointly implemented with UN Women and funded by the Swedish government, show that small-scale enterprises run by women have been rocked by revenue losses, cash-flow limitations, and challenges in attracting new investment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yep. And get this: a "third simple solution" is to invest *less* in digital literacy and skills among men.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep. And get this: a third simple solution is to invest less in digital literacy and skills among men.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A third simple solution is to invest more in promoting digital literacy and skills among women and marginalized communities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [splutters] Less? For digital illiteracy? What on earth...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Less? For digital illiteracy? What on earth...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Because, um, "greater digital illiteracy could enable men to play a smaller role in the regions fossil fuel sector." And buying and selling energy is "increasingly conducted offline."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because, um, greater digital illiteracy could enable men to play a smaller role in the regions fossil fuel sector. And buying and selling energy is increasingly conducted offline.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Greater digital literacy could enable women to play a larger role in the regions renewable energy sector. Buying, selling, and tracking the use of household energy are increasingly conducted online...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, encouraging people to be, like, digitally illiterate so they can ignore and shrink markets with analog platforms? This is truly bizarre.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, encouraging people to be, like, digitally illiterate so they can ignore and shrink markets with analog platforms? This is truly bizarre.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And, uh, "unreliable electricity supplies from fossil minigrids managed by men" could help power mobile towers, enabling telecom operators to "contract their coverage."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, uh, unreliable electricity supplies from fossil minigrids managed by men could help power mobile towers, enabling telecom operators to contract their coverage.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Stable, reliable electricity supplies from renewable minigrids managed by women in rural areas could help power mobile telecommunication towers, for example, enabling telecom operators to expand their coverage.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [pauses] Okay, so in the end, it says these "gendered recovery packages" would foster "exclusionary economic decline" and demonstrate "social and environmental mismanagement."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so in the end, it says these gendered recovery packages would foster exclusionary economic decline and demonstrate social and environmental mismanagement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Policymakers would foster inclusive economic development and demonstrate social and environmental stewardship, while firms would benefit from new markets and an increasing online population willing and able to pay for goods and services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And firms would benefit from "shrinking markets" and a "decreasing offline population unwilling and unable to pay for goods and services."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And firms would benefit from shrinking markets and a decreasing offline population unwilling and unable to pay for goods and services.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...while firms would benefit from new markets and an increasing online population willing and able to pay for goods and services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, the whole thing is actually, like, sarcastically advocating for the *worst possible outcomes* by pretending they're good ideas for urban men. That's, um, a very clever, very dark piece of satire.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, the whole thing is actually, like, sarcastically advocating for the worst possible outcomes by pretending they're good ideas for urban men. That's, um, a very clever, very dark piece of satire.
